name: Easy Pop Music Hits of 1985 Trivia Quiz | 1980s Music | 10 Questions

questions.text:
In 1985, Whitney Houston had a number one single in the U.S. with "Saving All My Love For You." Please complete this opening line from the song:

"A few __________ moments is all that we share..."
questions.explanation:
Stolen.

	"A few stolen moments is all that we share; you've got your family, and they need you there..." With these lyrics, a hit single was born and a career was launched. Whitney Houston enjoyed tremendous success throughout the late 1980s, and "Saving All My Love" proved to be her first number one hit single in the USA. This song topped the Billboard charts in October 1985.

questions.text: Which 1984 Eddie Murphy movie featured Glenn Frey's 1985 hit song "The Heat Is On"?
questions.explanation:
Beverly Hills Cop.

	Ex-Eagle Glenn Frey's song "The Heat Is On" was featured in Eddie Murphy's popular 1984 movie "Beverly Hills Cop." This movie starred Murphy as a wisecracking Detroit cop named Axel Foley. When Frey's song was released Stateside in the spring of 1985, it rose to the number two position on the Billboard charts by March of '85. Frey sang these opening lyrics from the tune: "The heat is on, on the streetInside your head, on every beatAnd the beat's so loud, deep insideThe pressure's high, just to stay alive..." "48 Hrs" was released in 1982, "Trading Places" came out in 1983, and "The Golden Child" was released in 1986.

questions.text: In 1985, the song "Take On Me" was a hit for which group?
questions.explanation:
A-ha.

	The Norwegian group A-ha performed the hit song "Take On Me." In the U.S., this single rose to the number one spot on the Billboard charts in October 1985. Morten Harket sang lead vocals for the band. This song was one of the highlights of the "MTV Generation": the video which accompanied this tune featured an incredible combination of animation and live action. Harket sang these lyrics: "Take on me, take me onI'll be gone in a day or two..."

questions.text: In 1985, the group Wham! had a number one U.S. hit single with "Careless Whisper." Who was George Michael's partner in the Wham! duo?
questions.explanation:
Andrew Ridgeley.

	George Michael and Andrew Ridgeley formed the dynamic duo called Wham! in London, England. The two performers enjoyed fabulous success throughout the world in the mid 1980s. The song "Careless Whisper" was released in the UK in 1984; in the USA, it climbed to the number one position on the Billboard charts in February 1985. Michael and Ridgeley decided to break up Wham! in 1986. For a time, Ridgeley drove cars on the Formula One circuit.

questions.text:
In 1985, Tears For Fears reached the number one spot in the U.S. singles charts with "Everybody Wants to Rule the World." Please complete these lyrics from this song:

"Acting on your best behaviour
Turn your back on ____________
Everybody wants to rule the world..."
questions.explanation:
Mother Nature.

	Tears For Fears was a British band which was led by Roland Orzabal. The song "Everybody Wants to Rule the World" went to the number one spot Stateside in October 1985. The group members sang the following lyrics: "Acting on your best behaviourTurn your back on Mother NatureEverybody wants to rule the world..."

questions.text: In 1985, Huey Lewis and The ____________ had a U.S. hit song with "The Power of Love."
questions.explanation:
News.

	Huey Lewis and The News hailed from San Francisco and recorded several high-energy, upbeat pop songs during the 1980s. "The Power of Love" became a number one song in the U.S. singles charts and was featured in the popular 1985 movie "Back to the Future." Lewis sang these lyrics: "You don't need money, don't take fameDon't need no credit card to ride this trainIt's strong and it's sudden, and it's cruel sometimesBut it might just save your life- that's the power of love..."

questions.text: In 1985, Phil Collins and Philip Bailey had success with a song called "Easy Lover." With which legendary funk group did Bailey sing?
questions.explanation:
Earth, Wind & Fire.

	Philip Bailey was an integral part of a legendary singing group called Earth, Wind & Fire. Bailey became well-known for his falsetto voice on many of Earth, Wind & Fire's biggest hits. In 1985, Bailey collaborated with Phil Collins on the hit single "Easy Lover." In the U.S., this song reached the number two spot on the Billboard charts in early 1985. Bailey and Collins sang these words: "Easy loverShe'll get a hold on you, believe itLike no other, before you know itYou'll be on your knees..."

questions.text: "Every time you go away, you take a piece of me with you..." Which singer had a 1985 hit song with these lyrics?
questions.explanation:
Paul Young.

	Paul Antony Young was born in Luton, England. In July 1985, his version of the song "Everytime You Go Away" topped the U.S. Billboard singles charts. This tune would be Young's only appearance on the U.S. pop charts during the 1980s, although he managed a number eight hit in 1990 with a cover of the Chi-Lites' song "Oh Girl."

questions.text: Which one of these songs was a 1985 international hit for the band Simple Minds?
questions.explanation:
Don't You (Forget About Me).

	In 1985, the Scottish band Simple Minds released a song entitled "Don't You (Forget About Me)", and this single climbed to the top of the U.S. Billboard charts. This tune was featured in a popular '80s movie called "The Breakfast Club." Jim Kerr and Simple Minds sang these words: "Won't you come see about me?I'll be alone dancing, you know it babyTell me your troubles and doubtsGiving me everything inside and out..."

questions.text:
Please complete this line from the chorus of REO Speedwagon's 1985 song "Can't Fight This Feeling":

"And I can't fight this feeling anymore
I've ___________ what I started fighting for..."
questions.explanation:
Forgotten.

	The band REO Speedwagon hailed from Champaign-Urbana, Illinois. In March 1985, this group had a number one hit single in the USA with "Can't Fight This Feeling." Kevin Cronin of REO sang these lyrics: "And I can't fight this feeling anymore; I've forgotten what I started fighting for..." The single "Can't Fight This Feeling" came from a 1984 Reo Speedwagon album entitled "Wheels are Turnin."
